shrimp.name: IndirectDiffuse
shrimp.author: rconstruct

input.name: minsamp
input.description: Minimum number of samples to use

input.name: hitsides
input.description: Side of surface to consider by a ray hit

shrimp.usage: Indirect diffuse retrieves the diffuse illumination from indirect light, allowing effects such as color bleeding. Coneangle defaults to PI/2. Distribution can be one of "cosine" or "uniform", defaulting to "cosine". This function can use an optional environment map to use when rays don't hit the geometry. You can also use point-based "indirectdiffuse". Note that this function varies considerably from implementation to implementation, so please consult your renderer's documentation for details. This function passes the indirect diffuse value into the "aov_indirectdiffuse", and the optional occlusion value into the "aov_occlusion" AOV presets (as occlusion, not 1 - occlusion).
